review: I refuse to pay for cable, b/c I hate commercials and s*** TV. I rely on the interwebs for all my watching - on my terms!!!  A guy in the IT department at work says that people like me are called "cord cutters".  Sounds cool.  Anyway, I'm also rather low-fi in my tiny house.  We have one laptop and wheel out an AV cart when it's time to curl up to some boobtube.  So, the chrome-cast was a blessing. I can control the TV from my phone or PC, and yet still use the device for simultaneously Instragramming and writing verbose reviews on Amazon.  All while I watch endless series that are a season behind the "corded" world.My one complaint - when you watch a series on Netflix, chromecast does not automatically start the next episode. A minor complaint, but seems like something they could fix??

review: Listening to music on Pandora is wonderful.  Now that Plex allows non-monthly subscribers cast content that is on their media server to Chromecast, you could send any of your movies that you have in the Plex Media Server to Chromecast.  You do still need to pay for the Plex app. It is $5 so it is fairly inexpensive for the convenience of watching your media.  It would be nice if they integrated the Chromecast feature onto the server.  This way you would not have to go to your smartphone all of the time just to play your content.I am sure more apps will integrate with Chromecast, so the fun has only just begun.
